org.mitre.provenance.plusobject.marking

Class Taint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.surrogate.Surrogateable
      • org.mitre.provenance.plusobject.PLUSObject
        • org.mitre.provenance.plusobject.marking.Marking
          • org.mitre.provenance.plusobject.marking.HeritableMarking
            • org.mitre.provenance.plusobject.marking.Taint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Comparable<Object>, Neo4JCapable, SourcedObject

    public class Taint
extends HeritableMarking
    Taints are special kinds of PLUSObjects that are asserted about other PLUSObjects. They show up in the lineage DAG as proper elements, but they are related to other nodes by non-lineage edges (i.e. PLUSEdge.EDGE_TYPE_MARKING)
    Author:
    DMALLEN

      • getStorableProperties

        public Map<String,Object> getStorableProperties()
        Description copied from interface: Neo4JCapable
        Get a map of the fields that need to be stored and their values in order to store this object in Neo4J. This is only a list of simple properties and values, and does not include any relationships the object might have to other complex objects.
        Specified by:
        getStorableProperties in interface Neo4JCapable
        Overrides:
        getStorableProperties in class PLUSObject
        Returns:
        a map

      • taint

        public static Taint taint(PLUSObject tainted,
                          User user,
                          String description)
                   throws PLUSException
        Mark an object as "tainted". This creates a new Taint object and links it one hop upstream of the provided object.
        Parameters:
        tainted - the object to mark as tainted.
        user - the user who claims this object is tainted.
        description - the user's description of the taint.
        Throws:
        PLUSException

      • removeTaints

        public static int removeTaints(PLUSObject untainted)
                        throws PLUSException
        Deletes all immediate edges to objects of type Taint, and the original taint object.
        Parameters:
        untainted - the object whose taints should be removed.
        Returns:
        the number of taint objects removed.
        Throws:
        PLUSException

                                               throws PLUSException

      • getIndirectTaintSources

        public static ProvenanceCollection getIndirectTaintSources(PLUSObject obj,
                                                           User user)
                                                    throws PLUSException
        Traces remote (even quite distant) sources of taint to a particular object. This way, you can find sources of taint even if it is outside of the scope of a single provenance graph. This query will NOT return *direct* taints.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object of interest
        Returns:
        a collection of taint objects, or an empty collection if there are none.
        Throws:
        PLUSException

      • getTaintSources

        public static HashMap<String,ArrayList<Taint>> getTaintSources(ProvenanceCollection col)
        This function provides a way of identifying all *originally* tainted nodes in a provenance collection. That is, the set of nodes that are immediately linked with a Taint object. This function operates on an already-assembled collection of provenance nodes, and does not consult any other database or source of information. As an important limitation, this means that taint objects not already in the collection will not be discovered. For discovering per-node taint, you may want to use getDirectTaints.
        Parameters:
        col - the provenance collection to search
        Returns:
        a map that maps OID of an object to a list of direct taints that it has under col.

      • getDirectTaints

        public static Set<Taint> getDirectTaints(PLUSObject obj,
                                         User user)
                                  throws PLUSException
        Gets the list of taints directly associated with an object, i.e. taint annotations on this object. There is also such a thing as indirect taints (inherited). This will not return inherited taints.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to check.
        Returns:
        a List of Taint objects, or an empty list if there are none.
        Throws:
        PLUSException
